content:
I was thinking if we had a slash command so that user can open his/her full profile modal using that.
/me appears very confusing, can we use it for that or some other command if this idea sounds good.
Using /me for another purpose, for someone used to other messaging platforms, is going to be rather confusing.
I guess what would be the motivation for wanting to do this, other than when working on that feature?
This also is a definite command/action, which I think there was an intention of treating separately to in-message commands?

being a little older and formerly a heavy IRC user using /me feels wrong.. ( https://en.wikichip.org/wiki/mirc/commands/me )

why not use a blunt /p(rofile)
I donâ€™t see a reason for this to be a slash command. I still think the whole concept of jamming slash commands into the compose box is misguided.
Yeah, I think only /me and widgets like /poll belong in the compose box, and structurally, they shouldn't be slash commands for other reasons.
